alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 2:47PM PDT until June 14 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Washington... Columbia River at Longview affecting I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and Lower Columbia zones. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Columbia River at Longview. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 13.5 feet, expect minor flooding of farmland and low-lying areas not protected by levees along the Columbia. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:18 AM PDT Monday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. Current forecasts indicate the stage ranging between 11.0 and 13.0 feet, close enough to warrant continuation of the flood watch through Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 800 AM PDT.
